column3: A building with a distinctly rectilinear shape and linear design elements. The structure is composed entirely of straight lines and angular shapes, creating a geometric appearance.
column4: A building with completely curvilinear forms and highly flowing lines. The structure features very wavy shapes and smooth, rounded contours throughout its design. The overall form of the building appears organic and fluid.

column3: A color photograph of a building rendered purely in grayscale tones. The exterior surface appears in black, white, and shades of gray, creating a monochromatic aesthetic.
column4: A color photograph of a building showcasing vivid and highly saturated hues. The exterior surfaces appears very colorful, with intense and rich colors.

column3: solid building, opaque building, enclosed structure, impenetrable building, or no windows
column4: glazed façade, transparent edifice, see-through structure, glass wall, or large windows

column3: A building with an asymmetrical silhouette and unbalanced structure. Windows, doors, and other architectural features are arranged asymmetric and are not mirrored.
column4: A building exhibiting perfect symmetry in its overall silhouette and design. Windows, doors, and other architectural features are arranged in a balanced pattern and precisely mirrored on both sides of a central vertical axis.
